sources.title: Border Guns (1935) BILL CODY
sources.description:
First Time on YouTube!
Stars: Bill Cody, Janet Morgan, George Chesebro
Directed by: Jack Nelson

A cowboy drifts into an Arizona border town and finds himself in the middle of a fight between the townspeople and a Mexican bandit gang that has been terrorizing the territory.

TRIVIA: Born William Joseph Cody on January 5, 1891, in St. Paul, Minnesota, he became a popular cowboy star during the 1920s and 1930s. Cody is often associated with the B-Western genre, where he played the heroic cowboy figure, a staple of American cinema during that period.

metadata.Plot: Bill Harris, looking for border rustlers and working undercover, rides into town and makes friends with Fred Palmer, one of the rustlers. They both take an interest in Jane Wilson. When the boss of the rustlers learns of Bill's true identity, he uses their attraction to Jane to alienate the friends hoping Fred will kill Bill.
metadata.Actors: Bill Cody, Blanche Mehaffey, George Chesebro
